name: knuckleheadbabylon
text: Phillipe is lying. His signature drink would probably be grape soda.

name: lastlarf
text: I thought it would probably be King Piss...

name: hipjiverobot
text: Yeah, he drank that with such a ferocious passion.

name: terebikun
text: Who love grape soda? Philippe loves grape soda...

name: terebikun
text: Oh fuck yes, first time with BBCode and [i]perfect[i].

name: terebikun
text: Oh good god no.

name: jlynes
text: You see?  You got too confident, and AssetBar decided that you needed to be taken down a peg.  And just when everything was going so well.

name: heccibiggs
text: terebikun is sorry to have an ego.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, but look how many chubbies he got out of it.

name: carlyle
text: Is... is it really that hard?

name: gtpbearsuit
text: YOU ARE SO ARROGANT!

name: rayonatoilet
text: Your avatar, all smiling and yelling at terebikun, made me laugh harder than the comic did. And the comic was really

name: panthera3000
text: HAHA you didn't finish your sent

name: mangtastic
text: Or Strawberry Rite.  (I think this was only mentioned in the blogs)

name: greenkoolayd
text: philippe isnt black....

name: anomalous3
text:
Dude, there's no way phillipe is retarded.
He might be borderline savant- a little slow in some ways and brilliant in others - not many five year olds can write a newspaper that long using proper grammar and spelling.

name: dartigen
text:
Spellchecking? And he does get help from the other residents/visitors.
Plus some five year olds are shockingly smart. I have seen five year olds read Tolkien before and do complex mathematics. Not a lot of them, but it is a documented phenomenon.

name: anomalous3
text: plus his vocabulary is insane

name: apocowarg
text: Don't forget that he gets a lot of help making these from Roast Beef.

name: i_love_kate
text: And he is quite well-versed in Humphrey Bogart quotes. You would say "Play it again, Sam," to him and he would just scowl at you.

name: wehavemagnums
text: It's good that Phillipe knows about Humphrey Bogart

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Bogie would be a terrible priest. I'm just saying.

name: endoftheworld
text: It's a crying shame we never got a Bogie film where he plays a hard smoking priest who punches out a guy in the confession booth.

name: dominus101
text: He plays a missionary priest of sorts in "The Left Hand of God". He has a gun, but doesn't punch anyone in a confessional.

name: atlanticcity
text: You just WAIT til I build my time machine.  Swear to God, I am getting this bitch made. It's always...been a simple dream of mine to see Bogie in such a manner as this.

name: geysershitdick
text: what the hell is bush planning to do about all the stabbings anyway?

name: red_dawn
text: Automatic death penalties.

name: epicurus
text: Both for stabbing and for being stabbed... it takes two for a stabbing, you know.

name: woof
text: alt text: It actually sounds more like something WC Fields would say to a kid as he poured rye whiskey over its head.

name: professorhazard
text: The alt text caused me to laugh out loud, thus qualifying this strip to be rated a five.

name: overmedicated
text: Who's L.B.?

name: madnes
text: Lie Bot.

name: madnes
text:
Also, Lester Bangs.

(this would be Lie Bot's answer)

name: killerlimpet
text: Lenny Bruce (is not afraid.)

name: relaxing
text: Leonid Brezhnev

name: kickstart
text: Leonard Bernstein

name: tellumo
text: Birthday party, cheesecake, jellybean, boom!

name: tekende
text: Lie Bot probably has better taste in music than Lester Bangs.

name: almightytim
text: For some reason I always assumed it was Lyle and that I'd missed a reference to a last name.  I think that line just seems like a Lyle line to me.

name: mcwee
text: . . . all the stabbings (shakes head); Christ, I'm glad I'm not president.

name: rotating-dog
text: The little shaver feels the need to apologise for boasting about his riddle prowess.

name: professorhazard
text: Pride is a Sin. Sorry, Jesus!

name: closefriend
text: Water is Philippe's signature drink. He craves the stuff.

name: pseudochron
text:
Best Friday Facts so far.

a stool that is being modified by the Army to weigh less

name: senatorexlax
text: I like to imagine that the line "Nice Pete is over, and he is saying that in the other room" implies that Nice Pete isn't allowed near Phillipe anymore after the secret ice cream incident.

name: mangtastic
text: I'm surprised they let Nice Pete within 500 feet of the little guy.

name: vreeeee
text: Man I got no words about that riddle.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Teodor: Finale (hopefully) of the recurring dream
Mr. Bear: Felled by the mighty Carnaroli

name: i_love_kate
text:
"Wordless Buddhist poetry welled up inside me, if you know what I mean."

I feel like this blog storyline was a bit of great character development for Cornelius, even if it wasn't quite as thoroughly amusing as the Russia arc.

name: clarcknova
text:
I was surprised.

And I'm also sorry for having en ego.

name: achilleselbow
text:
I'm surprised Philippe acts so nonchalant about Nice Pete being over after that whole episode with the secret ice cream place.

I'm also surprised that no one else seems to see his riddle about a guitar as an unintentional double entendre. Though what I'm thinking of lives in a furry cave when it IS in use.

name: ananke
text: No, that was much my initial response as well...

name: tekende
text: I'm pretty sure everyone sees it, it's just...I guess they don't think it's worth commenting on?

name: greenkoolayd
text: everyone who didnt make a comment to that effect is more mature than you.  grow up, sir.

name: velveteen
text: Is it me, or does Philippe look a little haggard on this column?

name: velveteen
text: This is what it looks like when someone comments before reading the whole strip.  Right there.

name: sealman87
text: I always wondered if that's a shirtless Onstad throwing the medicine ball back and forth in this one. Anyone know for sure?

name: biznart
text: That is exactly my opinion, William.

name: sealman87
text: I realized later that it isn't, because someone in the comments of another strip posted a website with pictures of Onstad, and the guy in this strip doesn't look anything like him. A friend maybe?

name: biznart
text: I do not have a witty retort that works as both a reference to the material and an answer to your question.

name: odei
text: Perhaps Onstad employed the use of Google Image Search or some such tool.

name: eatmorekix
text:
in case anyone didn't know, the real answer to the riddle is Man. in the morning of his life, man crawls on all fours, in the afternoon he walks upright, and in the evening of his life he walks with the aid of a stick.

in mythology, it is also the riddle the Sphinx asked people seeking entry into Thebes; only Oedipus answered correctly.

name: mangtastic
text:
Oedipus... that motherfucker

Oh god, I'm so sorry everyone but I just had to.


Also not every old dude walks with a stick so the Sphinx is full of shit.

name: njury
text:
Wait, wait that can't be right. If you take 24 hours as a man's entire life and start 0.00, you would probably start walking on two legs after like 1 hour, and keep walking on two untill something like the late evening (unless you had an accident ofcourse).

On second thought, the riddle was invented when people got like 40, tops, so it actually would be quite right.

name: tekende
text: I hate that riddle. It's completely stupid and cheats itself by using the various parts of the day as a metaphor without informing the riddlee.

name: cagliostro
text: Somewhere, the Sphinx is crying. She tries so hard!

name: evilbobikus
text: Nice Pete is completely right guys.  None of this fancy cook book nonsense will fill you up better than some country home fries and some eggs.

name: _pink
text: A comment left by _pink was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, atticusonline, Ravigotte)

name: tatterdemalion
text: Also, see: The Hammer.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: Isn't it weird how Phillipe has the hang of the bold and italics functions, but not the underline?

name: aezlo
text: I have read this strip multiple times and it was not until this time that I realized the second man is a copy of the first with a beard painted on. I am a fool.

name: a386
text: philippe admits he would have no idea what to do about all the stabbings. that is big of him.
